1.content: Are you a Jedi, Sith, Saber Knight, or other?
1.title: To which group do you belong?

11.content: An existing Jedi, or a new, made up Jedi?
11.title: Jedi

choices: They break through the other side to find a planet
Someone greats them on the other side
111.content:
You are Master Jedi T-Wana. You and your Padawan Oma-da have been sent on a mission by the Jedi Council to find the lost world Llum. It's a fool's mission. You're sure you have must have annoyed to council to be given this mission.

"Master, sector 1112-023 has been scanned. Nothing found", Oma-da announces breaking T-Wana from his meditation. T-Wana points his finger in another direction and says, "That way". Oma-da tilts her head and says, "Master, there is nothing on that direction. We scanned it already and found nothing". T-Wana smiles and says, "I didn't ask you to scan it again. I said to take the ship in that direction. Yes the scanners did not reveal anything and what is even stranger is that I did not sense anything. Even in space the Force exist. It mingles between microscopic dust and the hardy lifeforms that live within. Yet, right there I don't sense anything. Something is being hidden". Oma-da's eyes get wide and says, "Master, who would be capable of doing something like that"? T-Wana frowns as that is a question he has already himself and replies, "No one that I know of. No Jedi has that amount of power or skill with the force". T-Wana works to suppress his fear as Oma-da turns the ship and engages the engines. Oma-da is young and does not know yet the oddness of this. As the ship moves closer to the region of space in question T-Wana squirms a little. T-Wana is particular sensitive to the force. It is why he was told he was picked for this mission. Unlike other Jedi he can actually see it flowing about. As the ship nears this region of space he becomes more uneasy. A part of him wants to yell to Oma-da to turn around. Oma-da must be starting to feel it as well as she is starting to look uneasyl. "Master, I have a bad feeling about this. We should turn around", she says. T-Wana feels it as well and it only re-assures him that they are on the right path. Most Jdei would have never noticed this and few other would be going towards it. It's almost as if it was created to keep not just force sensitives out, but everyone. It speaks to a primal portion of the mind telling you to run the other way. T-Wana wipes the sweat from his brow and says, "Oma, set the navigation computers on automatic and time lock them. Set them not to unlock until we are through this". With her hands shaking she does as her Master commands. He then looks out as the darkness gets closer. He looks to the side and sees the flow of the force starting to ebb and vanish. Even with all his skills as a Jedi master he still digs his fingers into the armrest of the seat as they enter this strange area of space.
111.title: Existing

choices: They take them to the planet
1112.content: The area that seemed to lack any sort of life, the force, turns out to be a thin layer hiding something behind. When they emerge on the otherside T-Wana amazed by what he sees with his Force sensitive eyes. It's a world more rich with the Force than any he has ever seen. "Oma we have found it, we have found llume", he says quietly. Oma is more preoccupied with something else to hear. "Master, we are surrounded by three ships of unknown design. They have us in some sort of tractor beam", she exclaims. T-Wana takes his eyes off the planet and flips on the communicator. "Attention, unknown vessels. I am T-Wana on a special mission from the Jedi council", he starts to say but is cut off. A voice breaks in saying calmly, "We know who you are Jedi. You will come with us". T-wana sits back in his seat. "Master, I'm unable to detect the nature of the tractor beam they are using", Oma announces. T-Wana looks about the ship. The swirling colors of the Force wrap around it. Not only does he see it, but he can feel it very strongly. These unknown pilots are skilled and strong with the Force. This is confusing. If they were Jedi they would have introduced themselves as such. If they were the Sith there would not be so many and he and Oma would have been destroyed. There was though a story he heard once, a fairy told to young Padawans of a third people. "Could it be", he thinks to himself.
1112.title: Someone greats them on the other side

choices: Hosol has a message for T-Wana
11121.content: The strange ships guide T-Wana and Oma to the second planet in the system. T-wana looks out in amazement. The planet swirls with the power of the force. They descend through light cloud coverage to a small spaceport, but T-Wana's attention is on a building not far off. He senses that whoever dwells there is powerful with the force. T-Wana and Oma exit their vessel and are greeted by the pilots of the other ship. Oma looks to the objects attached to their uniforms. They are very familar to the young one and T-Wana as well. Each one of these strangers has at least a dozen light sabers. T-Wana approaches, bows, and says, "I am honored to meet the legendary Saber Knights". A voice then comes form behind and low. "An honor it is Jedi. Long time has it been since someone from outside our order come to llume", it says. The crowd parts and out walks Yoda, or atleast someone from his race. As if he is able to hear T-Wana's thoughts (probably because he can) he then says, "Yes, Yoda, a distant relitive. Hosol, my name is. Walk with me you will. We have much to discuss, Jedi".
11121.title: They take them to the planet

111212.content:
Hosol and T-Wana walk some distance before Hosol speaks, "Young Jedi, strong with the Force are you, but you could be so much more. A rare gift your Force sight is. Only one other I have met who has ever had it. Vadu, leader of our order he is. Only need to let go control of your emotions you must". T-Wana stops dead in his tracks. This is not the first time he has heard this kind of talk. Using your emotions to increase your power is a tactic used by the Sith. Could his belief about the Saber Knights have been wrong. They may be no better than the Sith. He and Oma could be in great danger. Hosol holds up his hand and says, "Understand you do not. Vadu you must meet". Hosol motions for him to follow. T-wana uses his Jedi training to supress his fears and follows.

A short time later they arive at the temple. Hosol rings a rather large bell and then says, "Come shortly, Vadu will". Hosol then walks off. T-Wana scans the area. The temple is stronger with the force than any other place he has ever been. It appears to be very,very old. Many Force sensitives have been here. Just then T-Wana feels a disturbance in the force and turns towards it. "I am Vadu, Jedi Master T-Wana", a voice in his mind announces. T-Wana is shocked to see that Vadu is...................
111212.title: Hosol wishes to recruit Hosol

1112121.content: Vadu is a dragon. Dragons vanished centuries ago. There were stories that they were stronger with the force than any other creature. Vadu's scales glitter like metal, but T-Wana does not see this. What he see's is the Force flowing around him, through him, and out of him. T-Wana gathers himself and says, "Greetings Vadu, if your intention is to sway me to the darkside we have nothing to discuss". Vadu erupts into laughter. This was not the response that T-wana expected, but is not a good sign. If the leader of these Saber Knights cannot control his emotional outbursts then they might possiably be swayed to the darkside. The voice in his head speaks again, "Young Jedi, your masters are misguided as are the Sith. Jedi believe they can reach balance in the force by denying half of it. The Sith believe they can have ultimite power, but not have that power tempered with wisdom and virtue. We Saber Knights were the original Force religion. We have balance by accepting everything. We do not deny or attempt to control what we are. The Force is not light or dark. Many thousands of years ago the First One understood this, his children did not. One of them founded the Jedi, the other the Sith. They converted many Saber Knights to their sides before the First One cast them out and hid this world. They then went out and because of their unbalanced beliefs about the force cast he galaxy into war that lasted centuries with each side gaining advantage for a short time only to fall and have the other gain advantage. This goes on to this day. Your order is even now about to loose it's advantage. I see the Sith even now growing in power as the Jedi weaken". T-Wana steps back. Every thing that Vadu says flies in the face of what he has been taught. "The Sith, gaining power. What is he talking about? The Jedi would have seen this", T-Wana thinks to himself. "The Jedi do not see it because they are blind to the actions of the Sith. The Sith use the force in a way that the Jedi cannot accept. Though we Saber Knight have never taken sides in the Sith Jedi war I have seen the number of lives that will be lost with the Sith in control once more. Even though it is years away I can feel and see the tremors in the force caused by their actions. Unlike before this time they will have the ability to destroy entire worlds in one stroke. I can't envolve the Saber Knights in your war. However, I can train you young Jedi and send you back to warn your fellow Jedi".
1112121.title: A dragon

11121212.content:
"You are wise, dragon, and you see much," said T-Wana "But do you really think myself and my padawan will be enough to stop what you have foreseen?"
"I have faith in you two," said Vadu "If there is a chance small as it may be, that you may succeed, I will hope for it."
"The Jedi will need something a little more than hope," said T-Wana "I accept your training, but I have one condition in return."
"If it is within my power, I agree to grant it," said Vadu
"I need a small task force," said T-Wana "Myself and my padawan are two Jedi in an entire order of Jedi, alone, we will not be able to convince them, but if we have concrete evidence of the Saber Knights, our words will carry a lot more weight with the council. Will you grant me this taskforce?"
"You shall have it," said Vadu "Like I said, I have faith in your success, you will have whatever you need to complete your task. Go and see Hosun, he will begin your training."
11121212.title: T-Wana accepts Vadu's offer

112.content:
His name was Jake. No one knew where he came from, he just appeared on a back world near the far edge of the alliance territory with little memory. At first, he seemed uninteresting, a normal humanoid who was found and adopted by a loving humanoid family. Thus, he was left alone... until his tenth birthday when his life changed forever...

The dream came again that night, as it had come every night for the past year. Lights were flashing and sirens were sounding all around him inside a hallway with people of every size, age, and description running passed him. Jake could not tell where he was, but he could sense danger and panic all around him. A muffled explosion shook the hallway and Jake saw fire surging towards him. A scream echoed from his mouth, just as someone from the frantic crowd swept him into his arms as he ran with the flames scorching his heals. He carried Jake though two other hallways, into a small room where a large number of people were desperately talking in a strange language he did not understand. An ear shattering explosion shook the room with a jolt and the door closed with a loud hiss, just as a slender young woman reached it with a small child in her arms. She pounded on the glass window of the door as four men inside the room desperately tried to force it open. A smaller, muffled explosion shook the room and it moved away from the woman on the other side of the door. Jake heard himself call out to her as stars came between him and her. He saw tears running down her face as she mouthed out his name, just before a brilliant flash filled his mind.

Jake woke up in a pool of sweat, as he had every night before since the repeating nightmares had started. Only this time, his frustrations got the best of him and he screamed out, clenching his fists. At that very moment, something clicked inside of him and an unknown force exploded from his body, leveling the walls around him. He jumped and looked around to hind his room, his house, his entire block flattened! Shaking, he searched for his adopted parents but they were nowhere to be seen. "Mom... Dad..."

Unknown to him, they had left to find him a present for his birthday. They returned later to find their entire block leveled and Jake missing as he had run away, fearing he had killed them and others. This sudden display of power, though it baffled Jake's town, did not go unnoticed. The power was felt a far distance by both the Jedi and the Sith. It was only a question of who would investigate first.
112.title: Jake

1121.content:
Ten year old Jake Typhe runs throughout the streets of the crystalline city of Sule, one of the many cities that rested right next to Jakes now destroyed town luminous . Tears fall from Jakes red eyes as he continues to run down the streets filled with people of different sizes and shapes, and yet still Jake did not slow down, he did not stop as he bumped into people rudely pushing them out of his way as he continued to run as if he was a solider on a dire mission. All Jake wanted to do was run, run away from the pain of losing everything, of losing the people he loved the most, his parents. Jake didn’t know what that mysterious force was that had enveloped his entire being, that destroyed his whole entire town, but deep down he knew that he was the cause of its birth. So he had to run, he had to escape.

“Jake!”

Jake upon hearing his name get called abruptly stops running, and with out wasting time looks for the source. As Jake looks through the entire crowd of people a face becomes clear, a face all to familiar.

“Sara!” Jake shouts out, happiness quite evident in his voice.

Sara Olen was jakes childhood friend. They had known each other since day one of Jake being adopted by his loving family. Sara was one of the only friends Jake had made, that didn’t really see him as weird, so they had a close relationship, the only problem was that Sara lived in the city of Sule, while Jake lived in the neighboring town of luminous. So it was quite difficult for them to see each other.

Sara upon seeing Jake in the middle of the crowd of people rushes over to him and hugs him with all of her strength, an act that caught Jake a little off guard, and yet the act wasn’t unwelcome, especially after everything Jake had been through.

“Jake thank all the gods in the universe that you are ok.” Sara says with happiness in her voice.

“Why wouldn’t I be ok?” Jake asks a little confused.

Sara releases Jake from her hug and looks at him with serious and yet confused eyes.

“How can you ask that, your town it was just destroyed by a mysterious attack.” Sara says looking right into Jakes eyes with sorrow.

“No one knows where the attack came from but the Republic is looking into it, this is a serious matter, many people think it is the immortal empire.” Sara says with worry.

Jake was amazed how word had already traveled about his town being destroyed, all ready speculation was already being made about the nature of the supposed attack. The immortal empire, one of the many enemy’s of the Republic and The alliance, that symbolized peace between the different colonies of both The republic and the empire, was being Blamed for the tragedy Jake had caused. That was how Jake wanted it . The last thing he wanted was for people to believe it was him that destroyed the town of luminous.

“I’m so happy that you managed to escape the town in time Jake.... where, where are your parents?” Sara asks turning her head left and right looking for them. Soon her eyes focus back on Jake.

Jake sees Sara’s hopeful gaze staring at him, and just couldn’t take it. Jake turns away from Sara and stares at the ground beneath his feet in shame.

“M-my parents are dead.” Jake says in a low whisper.

Sara’s face becomes pale, and all of the joy within her face quickly vanishes.

“What?” Sara asks hoping with all of her might that she didn’t just hear what she thought she had.

“I’m sorry.” Jake said as he continued to run down the street. As Jake ran he could hear Sara behind him calling his name, but soon this to disappeared as he vanished into the crowd.

Jake soon makes it outside of the city boards and what awaited him was thick jungle, as far as the eye could see. This was the Forest of Mindo, a thick forest filled with tall trees and wild animals. The whole city of Sule rested right near this forest, and even though it was dangerous Jake didn’t care. He just needed to get away.

Without hesitation Jake runs into the forest not looking back at the civilization he was leaving behind. As he stepped into the jungle Jake thought about his parents he believed to be dead, he thought about Sara, and the friendship he was forsaking. Tears once again began to fall from his eyes

“I’m sorry.”

Authors notes

Hope you liked my version of the story. Not a lot of action but I’m going to continue working on it. Please add. I love Star Wars but when it comes to information about characters and locations I don’t know a lot. So I’m pretty much starting over from scratch. So this story is after Yoda, Luke skywalker, it’s after all of the recorder grand masters of Star Wars history. So we are beginning something brand new. So please try to keep that in mind
1121.title: The sorrowful knows, Good bye old friend

1123.content:
"Who or what could have caused such destruction, Natal?" stunned, one law official asked. "Did anyone report seeing an energy blast or witness an explosion?"

"Nothing was reported, no one was in the area at the time of this... incident, Turin." startled, the second law official said. "Do you think the empire or the rebel alliance might have caused this?"

"Doubtful." with a frown, Turin replied. "Why would either power be interested in our world?" he motioned around him, adding, "We have nothing to offer, nothing they would want, anyway."

"How should we report this then?" raising an eye brow, Natal asked. "An unexplained phenomenon?"

"How else would you explain it?" sighing, Turin asked. "Let some mystery fanatic figure it out."

Elsewhere, Jake made his way to the space port where he found a group of Jawa trying to sell a long range ship for a thousand credits. That was cheap for a ship, making Jake believe it was stolen or found and repaired. Still, it was a lot of credits and he only had five hundred credits to his name so he tried to bargain with them. Waving his hand to show he had no weapons, he calmly said, "Five hundred credits is a good bargain, since it is not rightfully yours to sell."

The Jawas turned to each other then turned back to Jake before repeating his statement in their own language. Jake, knowing the basics of their language, smiled and gave them the credits before boarding the ship. It was a modified RZ1 A-Wing Interceptor, and in very good condition. Not that Jake knew anything about the ship, or cared, so long as it got him to the next star system.

"The controls seem easy enough to understand." muttering to himself, he said. "It looks like someone upgraded the weapons on this thing." he shrugged. "Let's hope I don't need to use them."

With that, Jake activated the engines with a quick series of buttons and piloted the ship out into space. He did not realize that he was working on instinct alone, as if he had flown the ship hundreds of times in the past. Before he knew it, he was flying away from his home world into parts unknown to him. "Goodbye, mom. Goodbye, dad." tearfully, he whispered. "May the next life treat you well."

Unknown to Jake, in another star system, a tall man in strange robes looked out a window, over a large planet as a another, very small, man approached him. "You sense something, Skywalker, yes you do." serious, the little man said.

"You Yoda are a very insightful people." calmly, the man, Skywalker said. "I sensed a brief but powerful disturbance in The Force, I can not tell where it came from but it felt like a birth of the mind."

"The Jedi sensed this when The Force awakened in you." smiling, Yoda replied. "The Yoda before me thought you to be the chosen one, he was right in many ways." pausing, Yoda added, "I sensed this disturbance as well but I feel we shall meet this one soon enough, let him come to us."

"I'm concerned that the new Vader will find him before then." frowning, Skywalker said. "Still, its his destiny. He will have to chose his own path and we can only hope he chooses wisely."

Hours later, Jake brought his ship out of hyper drive and scanned the surrounding Space for a planet to stop and earn credits to refuel and move on. Only as he did, he sensed a powerful presence in two separate directions. He paused, wondering what to do. To his right, was a blue planet. A strange feeling was coming from that direction. He had a good feeling about it, which made him nervous but also curious. To his left, however, he had a bad feeling. In that direction was a green planet. Ahead of him, a brown planet showed up on the sensors. Oddly, this planet had no feeling to it at all, which was not a good sign either...

Where did Jake decide to go?
1123.title: Leaving the nest.

choices: Jake wakes up in his ship
Jake wakes up in a hospital room
11233.content: As he was about to make a decision, Jake heard a warning alarm on the dashboard. He was almost out of fuel. He didn't have enough fuel to get to either the blue or green planets on his fuel tank, the brown planet was closer, so he had a better chance of reaching it. He asked the computer to plot a course for the brown planet, which he saw on the ship screen was named Raxus Prime. His fuel tank would get him as far as the planet's surface, but no further. He had heard of Raxus Prime, it was the galaxy's junkyard, the only inhabitants, as far as he knew, were the indigenous animals, mutated by centuries of waste. It was the last place in the galaxy that Jake could hope to make his fortune. But it was all he could do, he couldn't get to any of the other planets, they were too far off. He had nearly reached the planet. He could see it out the window. It looked like it was burning, the fumes of burning rubbish blocking his view of the planet's surface. His ship entered the upper atmosphere. The atmosphere was full of thick gas, thick enough to carry the ship. He turned the ship engines off, so he wouldn't risk igniting the flammable gases in the atmosphere. He then simply waited. There it was, a pocket of thinner air. He turned the ship to find the thinner air current, and felt his stomach leap. His ship dropped like a stone. He closed his eyes. Suddenly, the ship came to an abrupt halt. It stopped so quickly, that Jake was thrown forward and his head banged into the front screen. Just before he lost consciousness, he saw through the screen, a hooded and cloaked figure, both of his arms raised. Then, Jake knew no more.
11233.title: The brown planet.

choices: Jake decides to join the Saber Knights
112332.content:
As Jake came back to consciousness, he felt he was comfortable. He sniffed, and smelt, not the terrible stench of Raxus Prime, but disinfectant.
"Where am I?" asked Jake
"Your safe" said a voice.
The voice sounded old, wise, as if they had experienced a great deal.
"You didn't answer my question" said Jake, opening his eyes. He wasn't in a hospital room. He wasn't sure where he was. The walls were beige colored, similar to pictures he had seen of the Jedi Temple.
"Am I in the Jedi Temple?" asked Jake.
"No" said the voice. Jake looked at the person who had spoken. The creature was male, and was wearing the same clothing as Jake's rescuer. He was small in stature, had blue skin and pointed ears.
"This is the Ilum temple, the home of the Saber Knights"
"How did I get here?" asked Jake.
"I took you here in my ship" said the blue creature "Raxus Prime is a dangerous place for anyone who's not a droid"
"Who are the Saber Knights?" asked Jake "I've never heard of you"
"You've heard of the Jedi and the Sith?" asked the blue creature. Jake nodded.
"The Saber Knights are an order of force users outside both the Jedi and the Sith, we are masters of the Lightsaber and using it in conjunction with the Force" said the blue creature "I am Saber Master Yano, I was once a Jedi, but then I founded the Saber Knights"
"Why are you telling me all this?" asked Jake
"You have a gift, a strange gift given by the force, I ask that you join the Saber Knights and let us help you harness your gift" said Master Yano "What do you say to this, Jake, will you join us?"
112332.title: Jake wakes up in a hospital room

1123321.content:
"I have heard of The Force but I do not understand it." curious, Jake said. "Care to enlighten me?"

Yano smiled. "The Force is a power that exists in everyone and everything." simply, he replied. "It binds us all together, though we may feel worlds apart." his smile fell. "However, there are two sides to everything."

"The dark side of The Force." gulping, Jake said. "This is what the empire uses."

"Not everyone can yield The Force, many do not believe in it at all." serious, Yano replied. "Though you yield it in a strange way, The Force is strong within you and we can help you harness that gift, use it for good."

"I'm not so sure you would want someone like me." sadly, Jake said. "I killed my parents with my 'gift'."

"You think you killed your parents." softly, Yano replied. "I can sense your feelings and, through them, your thoughts. There were no signs of them, though you searched. Just because you could not find them does not mean they are dead." pausing, he added, "I sense their connection to you is still there, hence they are still alive."

"Then I must go to them." unsteadily rising, Jake said. "Family must come first."

"To do so would be unwise." seriously, Yano said. "I sensed your power, which was what brought my people to you."

"What does that have to do with..." irritated, Jake tried to ask.

"The Jedi and The Sith are certain to have sensed this power you have as well." interrupted Yano. "If they sense you no longer on your home world, they will both leave it alone but if you go there..."

Jake swallowed hard. "I had a feeling I needed to leave my home world." shaking, he said.

"The Force is a powerful ally." nodding, Yano said. "Though you do not understand it, you heeded its warning well."

Jake sighed then slowly offered his hand. "Very well, Saber Master Yano, I accept your offer to join the Saber Knights."

Yano took Jake's hand and shook it, his expression solemn. "You have chosen wisely, Jake of Tatooine2." releasing Jake's hand, he said. he raised an eyebrow. "However, I sense you were not born on that world."

"I wasn't." seriously, Jake said. "I crashed there but I do not know from where, my nightmares give little to go by."

"All dreams are visions but in code." motioning Jake to follow him, Yano said. "Perhaps, as you train, we can decode this dream for you and discover your origins."

Jake smiled at that, his first since leaving his family. "I'd like that."
1123321.title: Jake decides to join the Saber Knights

choices: "Go and meet some of the other students"
"I could teach you some more about the Force"
11233211.content:
Yano led Jake to a training room where several students were working. Each student held a single lightsaber and was fighting against another lightsaber. In the center of the room stood a woman, her arms out to either side. "This is Saber Master Sona Seer" said Yano. As he spoke, the lightsabers flew towards Sona Seer and deactivated, attaching themselves to her tunic.
"This lesson is over for now" she said "Go and work on your lightsaber technique"
Sona Seer walked towards Yano. "Master Yano, to what do I owe the pleasure?" she asked
"This is Jake from Tatooine 2" said Yano "He wishes to join our order, I thought you could give him some training in force usage"
"Leave him with me, i'll give him an introduction to the Force" said Sona. Yano bowed and left.
"You need not be afraid, Jake" said Sona "I can sense you are strong in the force, now, what do you know about the force?"
"It is an energy that is all around us, certain people can harness it, but some are afraid of being corrupted, I am not familiar with which side the Saber Knights fall on" said Jake
"The Saber Knights exist to keep the balance between Jedi and Sith" said Sona "Since we are neither Jedi or Sith, we are not limited by our emotions, we can use the force no matter our emotional state, but we are also capable of restraint, we each carry multiple lightsabers, and are capable of controlling many of them at once" She demonstrated by controlling six lightsabers in the air. Suddenly, one of them ignited and flew towards Jake. Jake flinched, but the lightsaber stopped in front of him, turned round so the hilt was pointing at him and hung there. He grabbed it.
"The Force is described as a sixth sense" said Sona "And in a way, it is, a popular Jedi training technique is to put helmets on their younglings to deprive them of sound and sight and let them sense the bolts and deflect them, we also use this technique" A helmet flew into Sona's hand, as well as a small, round object. She placed the helmet on Jake's head. Sight and sound ceased to be for Jake. Sona watched him. She turned on the training droid in her hand, and backed away. The droid fired. The lightsaber in Jake's hand moved of it's own accord, blocking the blaster bolt and sending it off to the side. He could sense everything around him, as if he didn't have a helmet on at all. He suddenly felt a strange vibe from Sona. It was similar to the dark vibe he had got when looking at the planets earlier. He had allowed himself to get distracted and a bolt had got past his defenses. The bolt hit his left leg. He deflected the next bolt and the next, feeling the bolts as they came.
"Enough" said Sona. The blaster fire ceased. Jake pulled off his helmet.
"You certainly have the gift" said Sona "Master Yano was right to bring you here, you could be the strongest Saber Knight ever"
"What do I do now?" asked Jake. Sona considered for a moment.
11233211.title: continue.

112332111.content:
"Go and meet some of the other students" she said "Make some friends"
Jake bowed respectfully to Master Seer and left.
Sona Seer was alone. She took out the training droid and turned it on again. It hovered in the air and fired on her. She deflected it not with a lightsaber, but with a sphere of force energy in her right hand. Suddenly, she heard a knock on the door. She turned off the droid with the force and went to open it.
"Daria" she said "Good to see you"
"Good to see you too, Master" said Daria "How did the training session go today"
Daria had excelled in one to one lightsaber combat, so had been promoted to a higher class.
"It went well, Yano introduced a new student to me, he was very strong in the Force, the strongest i've ever seen" said Sona
"What's his name?" asked Daria
"Jake" said Sona "He was from Tatooine's twin planet in the Unknown Regions"
"I felt his power from my quarters on the other side of the temple" said Daria "There's no question both the Jedi and the Sith will want him to join them, perhaps even within this temple"
"Who he makes friends with will affect him for all of his time here" said Sona "That's why I think you should befriend him first, make sure he doesn't fall in with the wrong people and cause a fight"
"I thought so too, Master, that was actually why I came here" said Daria "By your leave, Master, I will go and make friends with him"
112332111.title: A friend

1123321112.content:
"One moment, Daria." serious, Sona said. "There is one more thing you need to know."

Daria turned to Sona and hesitated, having never seen Sona so completely focused. "What is it?" almost fearful, she asked. "Does it have to do with this new comer, Jake?"

Sona nodded, her expression unchanging. "I sensed a dire need to find someone within Jake." her voice dark, she replied. "A brother... a twin brother."

"Jake has a twin?" surprised, Daria asked. "Have you sensed his power awakening?"

Sona shook her head. "It may have already awakened but was too far away to detect." gravely, she said. "This brother, no doubt shares the need to find Jake." pausing, she added, "If the force is this strong within him, imagine if they met?"

"Hopefully they'd meet on the same side." pausing, Daria said.

"One would hope." nodding, Sona said. "Go, forge and strengthen a friendship."

"I shall not fail." bowing, Daria said.

With that, she was hurrying out the door. It took minutes for her to find Jake but, when she did, she found he was...
1123321112.title: Sona has more to say

11233211122.content: As Daria came closer to Jake, she found that he was talking to a small group of Saber Knights who had drifted from...
11233211122.title: in a conversation.

112332111221.content:
"The power I am sensing from you is incredible." said an Aruzan boy. "I am Talon, formerly a Jedi apprentice."

"Why did you leave this Jedi?" curious, you asked.

"They are becoming more involved in a new conflict between the empire and the republic." frowning, Talon replied. "I would rather work to avoid such a war than to jump head first into one."

"A wise choice." nodding, you said. "I would have done the same."

"I went to the Jedi after discovering my powers." flatly, a Wookiee girl. "I am Shara. The Jedi were impressed by my powers but I was not impressed with their policies towards those who wander to the dark side."

"What do you mean?" worried, you asked.

"There are people here who had left the Sith, thus walking away from the darkside of the force." motioning to another group, Shara said. "The Jedi seem to give up on those who fall to the darkside, we can save them." pausing, she added, "We can save you before anyone try to tempt you."

After listening for a while later, Daria politely cleared her throat. "May I join you?" bowing slightly, she asked.
112332111221.title: The Jedi.

choices: It wasn't the bell, it was to signal an announcement
1123321112211.content:
Aruzan moved his chair to the side and Shara pulled another chair over for Daria to sit down.
"I must say Shara," you say "Your Basic is excellent, I didn't know wookies had the right speech patterns to mimic the language."
"Most don't," said Shara "I was born with a speech impediment which allowed my vocal cords to mimic Basic."
"I've only ever heard of one other wookie speaking Basic," you say "I don't remember the name, but Han Solo wrote about it in his memoirs, i've read them, he brought a shipment of bowcaster quarrels to Kashyyk."
"You've heard of another wookie other than me?" asked Shara, hopefully "I never met my real parents, I was raised by a human family on New Alderaan."
"It's easy enough to find out," said Daria "I'm sure Susanna would know if another wookie ever spoke Basic, she knows those books better than any Saber Knight in the temple." The other two nodded, but you looked from one to the other confusedly.
"Sorry," said Daria, seeing your confusion "Susanna is the master librarian in the Temple, she remembers every book she's ever read, I think she uses the Force to store it all, because if she didn't, i'm sure her head would explode."
The others at the table laughed, and you joined them.
"Shall we go now then?" you asked. Daria was about to agree, when a bell rang.
"Time for classes," said Shara, looking disappointed "We'd better get going."
"Come on Jake," said Daria "You've got the same classes as us."
1123321112211.title: She is allowed to join.

11233211122111.content:
The first class, as strange as it seemed to Jake, was force control. Yano was the instructor. "Welcome, young ones." politely but firmly, he said. "In this class, you will learn to use the force as both an open hand and a fist." he pointed to a long row of huge boulders, each of them were easily three times Jake's size. "Those rocks are your tools to learn this."

"I'm sorry, sir." raising his hand, Jake said. "How will huge boulders help us focus this Force?"

Yano smiled and held out his hand, open flat. "The open hand acts like a shield for yourself, a friend, a stranger." explaining, he said. "Look up."

Jake looked up and gasped, seeing one of the huge boulders hovering above his head! The others gasped as well as they did not see it move from its spot either. "How...."

"As a Saber Knight, you must know the tricks of both the Jedi and the Sith." serious, Yano said. "An attack can come from anywhere at any time when you are out there, trying to keep peace." pausing, he added, "The Force also acts like a 'third eye' warning you of such attacks, I suggest you pay close attention in your next class so you may learn to open that eye."

Jake and the others quickly nodded and Yano moved the boulder away from you, back to where it once was before throwing it towards Jake with unbelievable speed! Jake let out a surprised scream, holding his hands out as if to stop the boulder but paused as he felt a rush of wind. An instant later, the boulder exploded! Jake lowered his arms to find Daria standing in front of him with her fist outstretched. Yano smiled. "The fist acts like a sword or bludgeon to attack or defend, depending on the situation."

"That was not a fair example, Master Yano." unimpressed, Daria said. "Jake has no idea how the Force works within him, he could have injured himself or us all."

"I had full control over the boulder, Daria." patiently, Yano said. "No harm would have come to young Jake. Still, you have earned points by defending your fellow student." he then smiled. "You moved rather quickly, your feelings for him are strong indeed."

Daria blushed at that, as did Jake while low snickers rose then fell around them. "Just keeping our class in one piece, Master Yano." bowing, Daria replied.

"We will leave it at that, then." bowing in return, Yano said. "This class is dismissed."
11233211122111.title: Go with Daria

choices: Daria passes you one of her lightsabers
112332111221111.content:
"What's our next class?" Jake asked
"We're learning about the third eye that the Force gives us," said Daria "We are being taught by Master Horus."
"That's a strange name for a person," Jake said "Doesn't it mean 'all seeing eye?'"
"Yes that's correct," said Daria "Master Horus is blind, so he sees everything through the Force, and as the Force is in everything, he can see everything, but that comes at a price, he has terrible visions of things that may be and things that will be."
"Do you mean he can sense the future?" asked Jake, amazed
"Yes," said Daria "He actually foresaw your arrival in a way, his visions are like dreams, they can be interpreted in many ways."

Jake was going to ask more when they arrived at the classroom. There were no desks in the room. It was well lit for others convenience, but from what Daria told him, Master Horus didn't need light to see by. Lastly, Jake's eyes took in Horus himself. He was quite a tall man with a strong stature and the look of a warrior, emphasised by the five lightsabers hanging from his belt. His eyes were covered by a grey piece of cloth.

"Both the Jedi and the Sith teach the technique of the third eye," said Horus, his voice rang with the power his stature presented as well as thee wisdom behind his blinded eyes "Both use different techniques to do it, the Jedi use these-" he held up what looked like small, metal spheres in one hand "-they are made to wear a helmet to block their eyes, remember that your eyes can deceive you, don't trust them, the Sith use a different tactic to train the third eye-" Horus pressed a button and a hidden door opened in one of the walls of the classroom to reveal three silver combat droids, each holding a variety of different weapons in their multiple arms.

"The Saber Knights, however, use a mixture of both of these methods," said Horus. As he said it, shutters on each of the windows came down, blocking out the light from outside, the combat droids as well as the spheres in Horus's hand turned themselves on, and all the lights in the room went out.

Jake panicked a bit. he had not yet been given a lightsaber to use to defend himself, and he couldn't see anything.He prepared himself to dodge any of the blaster bolts that came his way. He had no idea how he would dodge the combat droids, but he would have to figure something out, and fast.
112332111221111.title: Next class, the third eye.

1123321112211111.content:
Just when Jake thought he was the most vulnerable, he sensed something moving at him fast and rose his hand to defend himself, hoping he could focus enough to use the force. To his relief, a loud clang was heard as the droid landed a fist on something just beyond his open hand. "I think I did it." whispering, Jake said.

He felt another swing coming but it had the sound of metal swishing through the wind. Curious, he did not hear any heavy breathing, meaning it had to be a droid unlike the person five paces behind him. "How am I hearing that!?!" Jake did not have the time to ponder over that as he felt a breeze too close to his face and he dodged, feeling something breeze through his hair. "This is getting serious!" whispering, Jake muttered.

The swishing sound came again and Jake used the force again, blocking the sword with a clang. He could hear the other students screaming and moaning from the droids and flying drones taking shots at them. Jake feared that many of them were getting injured and knotted his jaws in decision. "Enough of this!" a glow forming over his fists he roared.

With the moves of an obsessed man, Jake lashed out at the droid before him with one hand. There was a ripping sound of metal before the loud clang of the droid hitting the floor. There was a pause in the screams and mechanical sounds before Jake saw a number of red eyes approaching him only he remained still. A light saber came to life and took a swing at Jake only he dodged and took a spare light saber off the droid he had destroyed and counter attacked. The other droids followed but Jake threw his hand forward, throwing the small number of droids into the air. Screams were heard of the other students, scrambling to get out of the way. Jake was about to land his light saber onto the second droid when Horus called out, "Enough!!"

The blinds lifted, lighting the room and Jake saw that the droid before him had stopped its attack. Surprised, Jake looked around to find that Daria had leveled a number of droids and drones as well with the other students having merely held their own. "Well done, students." politely, Horus said. he then turned to Daria and Jake. "When you felt the breeze of the blade, did you know it was a droid and not a fellow student?"

"There was no breath coming from my opponent, master Horus." bowing, Jake replied. "I could hear another student breathing behind me and he was further away."

"Good, very good." his face softening, Horus said. he turned to the class. "The third eye does more than allow you to see danger coming, it allows you to tell the difference between an enemy and an ally in the dark."

"Does the third eye help us see where we are going in the dark?" curious, Jake asked.

Horus laughed, adjusting his blindfold. "What do you think, young one?"

Jake smiled. "I think I have a lot to learn."

Horus nodded. "We are all constantly learning." softly, he said. "Please report to your next class, you are dismissed."

What is the next class?
1123321112211111.title: The droids attack

choices: Jake has a lot to learn.
11233211122111111.content:
In the next class room you saw a tall, muscular man with greying hair standing side by side with a towering Wookiee who Shara seemed to recognize. "Papa!?" surprised, she said. "What brings you here!?"

The Wookiee replied in his native tongue, which Jake was surprised he understood. "We were invited here to teach this class, were you not informed?"

Shara shook her head then turned to Jake and the others. "Guys, this is my father, Chewbacca." introducing him, she said. "He frowns upon me joining the Saber Knights but is proud of my achievements here."

"I'm his partner, Han Solo." serious, the man said. "We are here to teach you tenderfoots how to fight without the force or your light sabers."

"Why would we want to learn that?" curious Talon asked.

Han Solo, instead of answering, suddenly swung his foot against Talon's right ankle, sending him flying to the floor before he fired off a laser blast inches from his head. "Had I been an enemy, you would be dead right now." darkly, Han Solo said. he offered his hand and helped Talon up before turning to the class. "The force is power to be reckoned with but it won't do you a damn bit of good if you do not know how to roll with the punches and punch back."

Talon, feeling embarrassed, tried to strike by using his force but was surprised when Han dodged the mental blast and activated a light saber in front of him. "You also need to learn to see an attack coming before it happens." smiling, he said. "You rookies make me laugh, knowing you all think you're ready to jump into battle when you don't know squat."

"The force must be strong with you." sweating, Talon said. "I will not challenge you again."

Han Solo grunted, turning off the light saber. "The force is not with me." surprising everyone, he said. "Not everyone can use its power, which is what makes you, the Jedi, and the Sith unique."

"What makes you so powerful?" curious, James asked.

Han Solo gave a short chuckle. "A rough life, hard lessons, and bitter experience." looking at Jake, he replied. "Such a life is not easy but it makes you strong enough to deal with whatever is thrown at you. The path you take brings what I dealt with early in life later in yours. The life of a Saber Knight is rough, you will get hard lessons and bitter experiences."

"Where do we start in learning had to hand combat?" politely, Daria asked.

"By testing each of you." serious, Han Solo replied. "One by one, you will each attack me with only your physical prowess and fighting skills. No weapons are allowed unless you want a blaster scare to remember your mistake by."

With that, Chewbacca stepped aside and Han Solo motioned Jake to step forward.
11233211122111111.title: hand to hand combat.

112332111221111111.content:
As Han punched forwards, Jake lent backwards, almost double, and swept his leg, meaning to trip Han up. Han jumped over his legs.
"Good," said Han "But remember that crouching to attack always leaves you vulnerable." Han punched towards the ground where Jake had crouched. Jake rolled out of the way, avoiding Han's punch before aiming both his feet at Han's side. Han, having crouched down to hit Jake, was knocked off balance, but he rolled and stood up again. Jake rose from his position, and raised his fists again, only to find that he couldn't see Han. He realized that Han was behind him, and putting his hands on the ground, he jumped and kicked behind him, kicking Han backwards.
Han stood up and said "Good, Jake, that was very good," He walked over to him "How was it that you sensed I was behind you?"
"I couldn't tell you, Han," Jake said "I wasn't using the force, per your instructions, and i'm not very good with the Force anyway, but I could still sense you somehow."
"Listen to what Jake says," said Han "There are creatures that cannot be seen in the force, against creatures that either cannot be seen in the force, or feed on the Force itself, all force users are defenseless. That is why you need to learn to fight without using the force. As for lightsabers, Jedi, Sith and Saber Knight alike rely on their lightsabers too much, perhaps the Saber Knights more than any of them, you need to be able to use any weapon that you can get your hands on to fight your way out, as there may be times when a lightsaber would just draw attention to you." Then, Han spoke directly to Jake "Go and have a rest, i'll want to talk to you later on."
112332111221111111.title: Jake does well.

1123321112211111111.content:
Later that day, Jake walked back into the class room to see Han Solo waiting for me. "I'm glad you decided to agree to come see me again." calmly, he said. "There is someone who would like to talk to you."

It was then Jake sensed a strong power and immediately placed himself on guard, ready to summon his light saber, if needed. Only he also discretely looked about the room for other objects he might be able to use as a weapon, if needed or he lost his light saber. Han Solo's lessons did not fall upon deaf ears.

"Please be at peace." appearing from behind a pillar, a hooded man said. "I mean you no harm and only wish to speak with you." he motioned to Han Solo, adding, "Han Solo would not have allowed this meeting if I were any kind of a threat."

"I have learned its better to be cautious when dealing with someone who does not show his face." flatly, Jake replied. "What do you want with me?"

"As I said, I merely wish to talk." lowering his hood, the man said. "I am Luke Skywalker, leader of the Jedi Knights, and I have come here to enlist your aid."
1123321112211111111.title: Later on

11233211122111111111.content:
"Why are you interested in me?" fearful but curious, Jake asked.

"Because the new Vader is trying to recruit a boy whom I think you know." calmly, Skywalker replied.

"Who might that be?" confused, you asked.

"He is in your nightmares every night." remaining calm, Skywalker said. "I believe he is your brother."

The images from my nightmares returned to me in a flash, the boy with my face in the arms of a woman, banging on the door, crying to be let in.... "I have a brother?" whispering, I asked.

"I can not force you to come with me but I may be able to save your brother from the dark side of the force." offering his hand, Skywalker said. "Will you come with me?"
11233211122111111111.title: continue.

112332111221111111111.content:
Luke leads you to a large transport that you recognized as the Millenium Falcon, the famous ship belonging to Han Solo and his partner Chewbacca. As you were about to step into the ship, you heard a shout. You looked around to see Daria standing on the ship ramp.
"Master Sona Seer wishes me to go with you, Jake," said Daria "She said Master Skywalker would understand."
"She wishes a Saber Knight to watch over Jake's training," said Luke "I guessed as much, come."
Daria walked into the ship. "Thank you, Master Skywalker," she said
"Luke, please," said Luke "The thing about the Saber Knights and the old Jedi order, they're far too formal."
"All right then, Luke," said Daria "With the permission of Saber Master Sona Seer, I have come along not to watch Jake's training, but to train him myself, as well as help him in his quest, whatever it might be, if I succeed, I will become a full Saber Knight."
"Interesting system," said Luke "All right, you can come along."

"We ready to go, Luke?" shouted a familiar voice from the cockpit. You looked to see Han Solo's face looking out of the open cockpit, Chewbacca's hairy side visible from the other seat "Who's the runt?"
"Daria," said Daria, her annoyance at being called a runt clear in the expression she shot at Han.
"We're ready, Han," said Luke "Let's go."

The ramp came up, shutting out the outside world.
112332111221111111111.title: You agree.

1123321112211111111112.content:
"I will start both of your training as my training started." serious, Luke said. "I know this may seem a bit old fashioned but, trust me, its harder than you might think."

With that, a small ball like drone lifted into the air. It had several tiny lenses everywhere on it that Jake guessed were low powered lasers. The drone was called a tagger, originally used to train elite Imperial troops in the use of stealth combat. If the taggers did not see and tag a cadet, it means he is doing well to avoid detection. However, in this case, the tagger was right in front of Daria and Jake so his guess was they had to fend it off with a light saber.

"You need to learn how to defect a laser blast with your light saber." pointing to the drone Luke said. "Now you may think that impossible but it is not. In ancient times, when we used projectile rounds, the Jedi were able to slice a round in half with a steel blade. This is no different."

With that said, Luke stepped aside and the drone began to fire a small barrage of lasers at both Jake and Daria while moving about. Jake found it easier than he had feared and blocked all but three of the laser shots with his light saber. Daria had a slightly harder time but she only got tagged four times.

"It seems to be all about increasing reaction times." curious, Daria said. "The faster you react, the easier it is to avoid being hit."

Luke rose his hand, freezing the drone in place. "Partly, Daria." serious, he replied. "Now, ignore your senses and work on instinct alone."

He placed a helmet onto both Jake and Daria's head with the blast shield down, blocking their vision. "This is no different than our night training with the Saber Knights." unimpressed, Jake said. "How is this going to make things more difficult." Luke did not seem to respond. "Luke...?"

Then the helmet was lifted and Jake heard Luke speak. "I responded but the helmet blocks hearing as well as sight." softly, he said. "A heavy blast can damage your ears as easily as it does your eyes. When you find yourself blind and deaf, you must focus on your remaining senses and instincts defend yourself in battle."

With that said, Luke released the drone and Jake tried his best to sense the drone. Only he took the first hit, forcing a grunt to escape his lips. "Damn..."

The helmet was raised. "Seek out with your feelings, Jake." Luke said.

The helmet was lowered again and Jake tried to do as Luke suggested. To his surprise, he found that he could feel the air being displaced slightly and moved his light saber in the direction, nothing hit him. He sensed something moving and he turned his light saber again, nothing hit but he felt a push on his light saber, he had deflected the blast. Finally, the helmet was raised and taken away and Jake saw Luke smiling slightly. "See?" calmly, he asked. "You can do it, both of you."
1123321112211111111112.title: Training with Luke and Daria

choices: Jake manages to win the duel
Han calls them in before they can finish
11233211122111111111121.content:
It was a few days later, that Daria took Jake for training of her own. It was between hyperspace jumps, Han and Chewbacca were making their way towards a spaceport to re-fuel.
"You seem to have a good grasp of basic Jedi tactics," said Daria "What your prior training has been lacking, is training in unusual environments, and use of the Dark Side alongside the Light."
"I don't feel comfortable using the Dark Side yet," said Jake "I fear it will corrupt me."
"Do you wish for power over the people of this universe?" said Daria "The Light Side and the Dark Side are not as black and white as you might think. What makes the Sith evil, and the Jedi good? Both have great power, both are skilled fighters, and commanders. The only thing that makes them different from each other is what they choose to do with that power."
"I see," said Jake, a little uncertainly.
"I did anticipate you would be uncomfortable using the Dark Side," said Daria "So, we're going to do some environment training."

She led him to the back of the ship, pressing the button to open the hatch. Expecting the vacuum of space to suck him out as she opened it up, Jake was surprised to find that it did not.
"Here, take these," said Daria, handing him a training lightsaber, and a breathing mask "I had Han expand the atmospheric shell, we're going to do some training in zero gravity." She put on her breathing mask, and dived out into the void. Jake ran to the edge, very slowly due to the gravity decrease. He saw Daria floating in the void, lightsaber drawn in one hand, and her other hand creating a force anchor that kept her from drifting off into the void.
"Come on, Jake," said Daria "Just jump." Instead of opting for the tactic of diving head first out of the ship, Jake jumped slightly, allowing the ship to go ahead of him, leaving him in the void. Jake focused on doing what Daria did, anchoring himself to the ship. He immediately swung himself towards Daria, slashing his lightsaber towards her. Daria used her own force tether to pull herself closer to the ship, at the same time bringing up her lightsaber to block the blow. Continuing his momentum, Jake couldn't stop, slamming into the side of the ship. Winded, he climbed up the side of the ship, creating a new anchor after relinquishing the first.

He sensed a presence in the force, and threw himself to the ground to avoid Daria's training lightsaber, her feet skidding along the hull of the ship as she came to a stop.
"If you dent my ship, I'll put a blaster bolt through your head!" Han's voice came through the comm.
"Sorry," said Daria, then ran towards Jake, her lightsaber a blur. However, in the zero gravity environment, the blur moved much slower, obscuring Daria from view. Jake couldn't see where her attack was going to come from. So he closed his eyes, and gave himself over to the force. He brought up his lightsaber, blocking where he sensed Daria's lightsaber would be, then spun around, bringing his lightsaber down to protect his midsection. Both times, lightsaber met lightsaber, sparks flying from them.
11233211122111111111121.title: continue.

choices: Jake has made it back to the Falcon
112332111221111111111212.content:
"Get in here!" Han interrupted their fight as they both somersaulted backwards to gain room to move "Now!"
"What is it?" asked Daria, as she made her way towards the still-open hatch. Before Han could answer, two small ships came out of hyperspace. The ship on the right appeared to be a modified version of the Old X-Wing fighters used by the Rebel Alliance, but with a different design marking it out as belonging to an outlaw. The one on the left was much larger, and looked very strange. It appeared to be a light blue body, bristling with long, blue spikes. The X-Wing banked to the right and moved along the right side of the Falcon's hull. When it had a clear shot, it fired three blasts into the Falcon. All three bounced off the forcefield. Daria ran along the Falcon and jumped, landing on the X-Wing's canopy, drawing two lightsabers mid-jump, and stabbing them into the canopy, shredding the X-Wing and it's pilot, throwing him from the canopy before leaping in herself. Turning the X-Wing, she started flying back towards the other ship. Jake jumped off the Falcon, sling-shotting the X-Wing towards the weird icicle-ship. However, before he could clear the top of the icicles, his feet found a forcefield.

"Jake, get the hell off there!" Daria's voice sounded panicked, so Jake didn't hesitate. He jumped off the forcefield. Looking back, he saw a pressure building from the ship. Then, a huge orb of energy discharged from the icicle-ship. Jake, once again sling-shot around the X-Wing, but this time, he stopped himself in front of the X-Wing, and focused all of his force energy to create a wall of force around the X-Wing. Luckily, the orb of energy went around them, leaving the X-Wing unscathed. It hit the Falcon, however, and the light in the cockpit went out.
"Must have been an electromagnetic pulse," said Daria "That thing must have just shorted out the Falcon's shields, they'll be defenceless."
All she heard was static. Examining the ship, she couldn't detect the shields using the Force, her instruments, while still functioning, had gone haywire after the pulse. She flew around the ship, sensing a large power source from the bottom of the ship. Locking onto it with the force, she fired a photon torpedo, which caught what her instincts told her was the engine. It exploded, splintering the orb-like ship in half.
112332111221111111111212.title: Han calls them in before they can finish

13.content: Are you male or female?
13.title: Saber Knight

13111.content:
You are Saber Master Ray Tanner. You have knowledge of the lightsaber form Niman, as well as Vaapad. One of Mace Windu's former pupils had enrolled at the Ilum Temple, and had added her knowledge of Vaapad to the Ilum Temple archives. You had become a master of Vaapad. You carried several lightsabers. Today, you reported to the Saber Knight council. As you arrived, you saw that only one member of the council was present, Grand Saber Master Yano. Yano had been Jedi Master Yoda's first apprentice, but while he was forging his lightsaber in the Ilum caves, the visions he saw told him of the One's, a group of force users who weilded the power of the dark, light and balance of the Force. He forged the order of Saber Knights. Yano was a strange looking creature, only as tall as your knee, but one of the strongest force-users in the galaxy, his skill with a lightsaber was unequalled. With his blue skin and pointed ears, he looked a lot like Yoda himself, save his skin.
"Naboo, you must go to" said Yano, getting directly to the point "Under siege by the Trade Federation, Naboo is, Jedi have been sent to find out what's happening there, reveal yourself, you must not"
"Master Yano, wouldn't it be better to reveal ourselves to the Jedi, rather than leave them to struggle with what is to come?" you ask
"Reveal ourselves to the Jedi, the time for it this is not" said Yano "The time will come, Master Tanner, patient you must be"
13111.title: Character 1

131111.content: You put your ship into cloak mode, before you came out of hyperspace. You didn't want to take any chances that the Trade Federation would notice you. You left most of your lightsabers at the temple, taking only two with you, hidden beneath your clothes. The population of Naboo was human, if they Trade Federation had not yet attacked, you could blend in. You landed your ship, still cloaked. You decided the best place for you to be would be near the palace, as that would be where the Trade Federation would be likely to strike. You melted into the Theed, the capital city of Naboo. Finding native clothing, you easily blended into the throng of men, women and children The Force was everywhere, there was a large concentration of darkness in the air, and it was descending, fast. It was a lander. The doors of the lander opened and several hover tanks rolled out. You sensed a small surge that told you the Jedi were hiding in one of the tanks. You smiled, they were good. But you were better. You quickly sneaked into Theed Palace, found a guard room and stole a uniform and gun, keeping your lightsabers hidden under your uniform, you went to the throne room and took up a position next to Queen Amidala. You were no fool. You knew you, and everyone in this room were going to be captured by the droids. You also knew that the Jedi would soon arrive and if they broke in top rescue the Queen, you would need to aid them. You would have to allow the droids to capture you.
131111.title: Go to Naboo

choices: Wait until the ship takes off then escape
Wait until the ship takes off, then attack
1311111.content:
Queen Amidala watched from the window as the droids descended. Her handmaidens stood behind her, her guards, you included, to either side. The door to the throne room opened and several battle droids entered, holding blasters. "Drop your weapons" said the droid. The guards cocked their weapons and pointed them at the droids. Suddenly, six destroyer droids rolled into the room. You, and the rest of the guards, dropped your guns. "You will come with us" said the droid. The six destroyer droids set up positions to either side of the group and marched them from the room. They took you outside, where they were attacked by two Jedi. No droids survived. You and the other guards grabbed guns from the dead battle droids.
"We must make haste, your Majesty" said the older of the two Jedi "The city of Theed is taken, we must get you to Coruscant" The Queen nodded. The two Jedi led the group towards the hangar. When they got there, they saw that it was crawling with droids. "Right" said the older Jedi, who called himself Qui Gon Jinn "We need to get to the ship, we'll need a distraction"
"I can provide a distraction" you say, you had to get away from these Jedi, they were close to finding out you were a force user. Qui Gon nodded. You sneaked off to the side, then attacked with the blaster, blasting droids everywhere, then, you feigned a blaster hit, hoping the Jedi would think you were dead. You used the force to mask your life signs and yourself in the force. Qui Gon and the others ran for the ship.
1311111.title: Allow capture

13111111.content:
You waited until the Queen's craft took off and left, then used the Force to make yourself invisible to man and machine. You sneaked back to your ship, then left to go back to Ilum. As your ship landed back at the Ilum temple, you saw Master Yano waiting for you.
"News, you have?" asked Yano
"Queen Amidala has left for Coruscant" you say "I'm sure they'll send help to Naboo"
"Done well, you have" said Yano "Go and train for a while, you must"
You walked into the Ilum temple and went to watch the younger students training. Unlike Jedi, the Saber Knights did not take students at infancy, the native sentients of Ilum, if they were force sensitive, as many were because of close proximity to the Ilum crystals, could be taken for training at any age. As a result of this, there were new students of all ages. You decided to sit and watch the young ones train. Saber Master Sona Seer was taking the lesson. She could control more lightsabers with the Force than any other Saber Knight. She was given the nickname 'The Hedgehog' because of the amount of lightsabers she could control.
13111111.title: Wait until the ship takes off then escape

choices: You see a student you wish as a padawan
Yano comes to the room, looking for you
131111112.content:
"Master Tanner, perhaps you could assist me with this part?" asked Master Seer. You nodded and got up, standing facing her.
"The Force is not a weapon, it should be used only in knowledge and defence, but if your opponent uses the force to attack, you must be prepared to defend" Without even taking her eyes off her students, she used the force to hurl a light saber at you. You instinctively used the force to slow it down. You met Sona Seer's full force concentration behind the light saber, or at least you thought it was her full concentration. Five more lightsabers were soon floating in the air, stopped by you at the same place as the others.
"A Jedi would disengage and dodge the lightsabers" you said, picking up on Sona's thread "A Sith would use his force lightning to catch the attacker off guard, a Saber Knight does none of these things, The Lightsaber is his life and his art, he moves with the force and the lightsabers" You jumped into the air and landed with one of your feet placed on each of two of the ligthsabers handles. You then released your force grip on the lightsabers you were not standing on and transferred all the energy to pushing back against Sona's force grip on the remaining two. The three lightsabers you had released flew at the place you had been. The other two slowly moved towards Sona Seer. You reached into your robes and drew one of your own light sabers, before igniting it. You then jumped into the air, releasing your force grip on the two lightsabers you had been standing on and withdrew your second lightsaber, landing behind Sona Seer, placing both your lightsabers in an X across her throat.
"Thank you, Master Tanner" said Sona Seer. You deactivated your lightsabers and used the force to help Sona Seer retrieve hers.
Sona Seer addressed the students. "The lightsaber can be manipulated in several ways, a Saber Knight carries many lightsabers, Master Tanner here owns several, I myself have created dozens, the point is to use the force with the lightsabers in creative ways that your opponent would not have thought of, Master Tanner did something that few would have expected, you must be unpredictable in your movements and attacks, this is the key to the Saber Knights, now, time for a tutorial in lightsaber use"
The assembled students drew and activated their lightsabers. Dozens of lightsabers flew out of Sona's robes and activated. Each one flew towards a student. The students took defensive positions, then the lightsabers attacked. You smiled. How Sona Seer controlled so many lightsabers at once, you would never know. You retreated to the side of the room and watched the students. You had never taken a padawan, and had decided to come and observe the students with a view to taking one.
131111112.title: Assist with the lesson

1311111121.content:
As you stood in the centre of the room beside Sona Seer, looking around at all the students fighting, Sona Seer spoke
"You didn't come here to assist with the lesson, did you Ray?" she said
"That is true," you say "I came with the view to taking on an apprentice of my own, I have never taken one before and I think now is the time for me to pass on my knowledge to an apprentice."
"Choosing an apprentice should not be a hasty decision," said Sona Seer "I deliberated at great length before taking on Padawan Daria as my own apprentice, even now I don't know if it was the right decision, she senses the darkness in me."
Sona Seer had once been the personal assassin of Darth Plagus, a Sith Master, but after he had taken on an apprentice, he had cast her out. She had travelled the universe, knowing she would never be accepted by the Jedi, she had still been a young girl then, but still too old to become a Jedi. Eventually, just before her thirteenth birthday, she crash landed on Ilum. By lucky coincidence, she landed right in front of Saber Master Yano. Tired and hungry, her force power spent, she expected to die there. But Master Yano had other ideas. He took her to the Saber Knight Temple and nursed her back to health. When he found out about her force sensitivity, he offered her a place with the Saber Knights, but she refused, leaving to go and assassinate her former Master. She later returned, her mission accomplished, and took up Yano's offer of training in the ways of the Saber Knights.
"No one is judging you for your time with Darth Plagus," you say, comforting Sona "It's not who you were before that matters, its who you are now."
"Thanks Ray," said Sona "Watch Marielle over here, I think she might be the perfect padawan for you."
You turn to see a tall girl, abotut fifteen or sixteen, with white blonde hair, modest figure and breasts and wearing a white top and blue bottoms. She held a double sided lightsaber in one hand and was whirling it around her, deflecting the lightsaber fighting her while going on the offence with a single bladed lightsaber in her other hand.
"Tell me about her," you say, continuing to watch her fight.
"Marielle Regalia was born on Correlia to a wealthy family, she was plagued with visions of her family being destroyed in some form of protest. Little did she know that that protest would be because of her force sensitivity coming out. Her home was attacked and her parents killed by the protestors. She would have also been killed if a group of Jedi had not rescued her and left the planet. By this time she was fourteen, too old to be trained in the Force by the Jedi. They planned to take her to Coruscant and put her up for adoption there."
"How did she end up here then?" you asked
"The Jedi ship was attacked, shot down by a bounty hunter novice over Ilum, they made an emergency landing and the bounty hunter assumed they were dead, their crashed ship was found by the Saber Knights a few days later, we nursed them back to health and then asked Marielle if she wanted to stay, she said yes and we wiped the Jedi's memories of us and sent their ship back into the atmosphere repaired, Marielle stayed and trained to become a Saber Knight," Sona finished "She's been training here for two years."
"She seems like a good apprentice for me," you agree "I'll talk to Yano, see if he approves, then I'll talk with her."
1311111121.title: You see a student you wish as a padawan

choices: Yano tells you of your next mission
13111111211.content:
You found Yano in his meditation chamber, above him, floating in the air were twelve deactivated lightsabers. You sat down in one of the chairs in the room and waited. A few moments later, Yano opened his eyes.
"I sense that you came here with the intent to taking an apprentice," said Yano. It was a statement, not a question. Yano had always been the most powerful force user in the temple, surpassing even Sona Seer in lightsaber combat on occasion. It also gave him the ability to read people's intentions in great detail, to such a degree that it seemed he could read minds.
"Which student are you interested in taking?" Yano asked.
"Marielle Regalia," you replied "I think she could learn a lot from me."
"True," said Yano "But remember when you are her master, training a Padawan goes both ways, the master can learn from the apprentice as much as the apprentice learns from the master."
"Thank you, Master Yano," you say "I will remember that, you approve my choice?"
"It is your choice to make," said Yano "My personal opinion is that she would make a great Padawan for you, but do not choose a Padawan solely on my opinion, you must follow your own path, not one chosen for you by others such as myself."
"You have been a great help Master Yano," you say, bowing "Thank you for your wisdom on this matter, but I have made a decision, I shall take Marielle as an apprentice."
13111111211.title: Talking to Yano first

131111112112.content:
"I have another mission for you," said Yano "A young Jedi has become disillusioned in the Jedi ordeals, he does not wish to continue to train with the Jedi, but does not wish to join the Sith, unfortunately, he has been captured by a bounty hunter with an unknown employer, we have reason to suspect Plagus' apprentice."
"What do you wish us to do, Master?" you asked.
"Go to Tatooine, the base of the bounty hunter that captured the young Jedi, once you find her, tell her about the Saber Knights and offer her a place with us," said Yano, "If she refuses, come home, if she accepts, she can come home with you."
"What's the Jedi's name?" you asked
"Selene Sentara," Yano replied "Bring Marielle with you, it's time you began her training."
"I guess I'll go tell her the good news," you say, leaving Yano's meditation chamber.
"Ray," said Yano, you turned "Be careful, I sense the bounty hunter has a powerful force presence, I am unsure of his source of training, but he is powerful, he will most likely sense you coming, mask your presence in the Force whenever you can."
You nodded, closing the door behind you.

You went back to the training area, most of the Padawans had left to go to other classes, but Maria was still there, training with multiple lightsabers against a robot.
"I saw you fight earlier," you say, catching her attention. She used the Force to turn off the robot, then retrieved her lightsabers from the air, clipping them back onto her clothing.
"I would like to take you on as my apprentice, if you'd be willing," you say "I think we would work well together."
"I accept," said Maria "I, Maria Regalia, padawan of the Saber Knights, pledge myself to be the padawan of Saber Master Ray Tanner."
"I, Saber Master Ray Tanner, accept Maria Regalia as my apprentice, and promise to train her to the best of my ability," you replied, continuing the traditional formalities "Now, we must go, I've just been given a mission from Yano, I'll explain on the way to the ship."
131111112112.title: Yano tells you of your next mission

1311111121122.content:
You got into the two-seater ship, with Maria getting into the other. You had finished explaining the particulars of your mission to her on the way to the ship.
"Now," you say "We'll have to appear as Jedi, so I've got some Jedi robes in the cargo hold, you'll have to only show a maximum of two lightsabers, you can bring more, but be sure they are unseen."
"Oh, that shouldn't be a problem," said Maria, pressing small buttons on each of her excess lightsabers. They all vanished, leaving only Maria's clothes behind "Small scale cloaking device," she said "It's a miniaturised version of the ones used on big ships, I developed it in my free time, the lightsabers are still there, if anyone searched me, they'd find them immediately, but from a distance, I can appear to have only two lightsabers."
"That has got a lot of flaws," you said, "But none we can work out now, I'll work with you on it, it'll have to do for now, though, I just hope your cloaking device works in the field, let's go."

You landed a few hours later at Mos Eisley Spaceport. You booted up the security system on the ship, honestly you would have been stupid not to, Mos Eisley was full of the lowest of the low: criminals, looters, bounty hunters, they all ended up at the spaceport sooner or later. You walked into the Mos Eisley Canteen, where you walked up to the bar, and ordered drinks for yourself and Maria. When the barman came over, you said
"We're looking for a bounty hunter,"
The barman laughed "Look around, my friend, there are many bounty hunters here,"
"I'm looking for a very specific bounty hunter," you said "Goes by the name Sool Carben, I hear he came here with a prisoner sometime in the last week."
"Your very well informed for an outsider," said the barman "And you should know that we don't like your kind here, Jedi."
You looked at Maria, wondering what to do. She smiled. You saw her subtly switch one of her lightsabers with the cloaked ones, then ignite it. The blade glowed red.
"Trust us," she sneered "We're no Jedi."
"We've tried to be polite," you said, picking up on Maria's thread, you looked around to see that every person in the room had drawn a weapon, and every weapon was pointed at Maria. You put both your hands out to either side, using the force to pull every gun from the had of the person holding it "Tell us where the hunter is hiding, and we'll walk out of here, and no one has to die."

You walked out of the canteen a few minutes later, and smiled at Maria as you did.
"That was brilliant," you said "If a little unorthodox, they might call the Jedi council, then they'd come here looking for the two Sith who were here."
"We'd be long gone by then," said Maria "Anyway, that's not important right now, we know where the Sith bounty hunter and the Jedi are, we need to go there."
You rented a landspeeder, and drove it out to a moisture farm right on the edge of Mos Eisley. Stopping a few miles away, on a low hill overlooking the farm, you pulled out some binoculars and observed the farm. It seemed deserted, as Mos Eisley grew, moisture farms had to relocate further and further out because of lack of water close to the city. This one must have been abandoned long ago.
"I sense one presence," you said "Can you sense the other?"
"No," said Maria "Feels like the Jedi is in there, the Bounty Hunter musn't be there."
"We're clear then," you say "We'll go in and free the Jedi, free them, then find the Bounty Hunter."

You both ran down the sand dune you had been watching from, running fast towards the farmhouse. Getting there, you found the door was locked.
